title: Flipped Learning-Based Social Issue-Solving Project

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic social science concepts and ability to utilize digital devices
context.additional_context: Combining self-directed learning via mobile-based LMS with offline problem-solving activities

learning_goals: Learners acquire at least three pre-learning materials related to social issues per week using mobile LMS in flipped learning environments
Learners analyze real-world social issues through Problem-Based Learning (PBL) and apply a 4-stage problem-solving process: problem definition, solution development, implementation, and evaluation.
Learners maintain self-efficacy, motivation, and academic interest at over 80% while writing reflective journals for 6 weeks.
Learners present team-based solutions to social issues in the final project and achieve over 70 points based on expert evaluation criteria (creativity, feasibility, effectiveness).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
